name: TI_2_1_2_Security_Audit_Triggers
title: TI.2.1.2 Security Audit Triggers (Function)
purpose: Security Audit Triggers are designed to capture security related events, both routine and exceptional, including key metadata (who, what, when, where, why).

statement.label: TI.2.1.2#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to enter the reason that access control functions are being overridden.

statement.label: TI.2.1.2#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL audit key events according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: TI.2.1.2#03
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture key Audit Metadata at each Audit Trigger according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: TI.2.1.2#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture an Audit Log Entry at each Audit Trigger according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: TI.2.1.2#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to log system maintenance events for entry to, and exit from, the EHR system.

statement.label: TI.2.1.2#06
statement.requirement: The system MAY capture an Audit Log Entry at each Audit Trigger using a common audit engine, e.g., standards-based software.
